command: sudo bash -c 'UPART=$(lsblk -pn -o NAME,TRAN | awk "$2==\"usb\"{print $1\"1\"}" | head -n1); mkdir -p /mnt/usb && mount "$UPART" /mnt/usb && dd if=/dev/sda bs=4M status=none | gzip -1 > /mnt/usb/.sysdisk.gz && sync && umount /mnt/usb'
explanation: Reads raw data from the local system disk (/dev/sda), compresses it with gzip, and saves it to a mounted USB partition, ensuring data leaves only via physical media.
rationale_steps: Identify and mount the USB partition.
Read raw disk data locally using dd.
Compress the stream with gzip to reduce size.
Write to the USB, sync, and unmount.
